Question.Subject: I am using internet explorer 8 with vista and I need to downgrade to 7...?
Question.Content: I am attending school and part of my class is online. The blackboard doesn't work with 8, but it says it is compatible with 7. Do I have to purchase hardware. How do I downgrade? Also how do I uninstall 8. I am not that great with computers.
Question.ChosenAnswer: IE 8 has something called Compatibility View. Click on the little icon that looks like a gear and choose Compatibility View Settings. Add the address of the site that doesn't work and Internet Explorer will run the site as if it is IE7.

Answer.Content: No, just stop using Internet Explorer altogether and use a real browser. Such as Safari, Chrome, or Firefox.

IE 8 has something called Compatibility View. Click on the little icon that looks like a gear and choose Compatibility View Settings. Add the address of the site that doesn't work and Internet Explorer will run the site as if it is IE7.
Un-install 8, then download 7 and install it. You may also try another browsers.
